conditions.name: Flu
conditions.description: A common and contagious respiratory illness caused by a virus that can lead to fever, body aches, and fatigue.

conditions.name: Malaria
conditions.description: A serious disease spread by mosquitoes that causes recurring fevers and chills due to a parasite infecting red blood cells.

conditions.name: Migraine
conditions.description: A type of severe headache often accompanied by throbbing pain, sensitivity to light and sound, and sometimes nausea.

conditions.name: Serotonin Syndrome
conditions.description: A potentially dangerous reaction caused by too much serotonin in the brain, often due to certain medications, leading to symptoms like agitation, rapid heart rate, and confusion.

conditions.name: Weber Syndrome
conditions.description: Midbrain stroke affecting cerebral peduncle with ipsilateral CN III palsy and contralateral hemiparesis

conditions.name: Wallenberg Syndrome
conditions.description: Lateral medullary syndrome (PICA territory) with ipsilateral facial sensory loss, Horner's, ataxia, and contralateral body sensory loss

conditions.name: Millard-Gubler Syndrome
conditions.description: Ventral pontine stroke with ipsilateral CN VI and CN VII palsy and contralateral hemiparesis

conditions.name: Lateral Pontine Syndrome
conditions.description: AICA territory infarction with ipsilateral CN VII, CN VIII palsy, ataxia, and contralateral pain/temperature loss
